channel.title: Publications on Carl Müller-Crepon
channel.description: Recent content in Publications on Carl Müller-Crepon

item.title: At Any Cost: How Ukrainians Think about Self-Defense Against Russia
item.description: In a conjoint experiment, we find Ukrainians to categorically reject political and territorial concessions.

item.title: Shaping States into Nations: The Effects of Ethnic Geography on State Borders
item.description: We analyze the effect of ethnic geography on the partitioning of Europe into states.

item.title: Building Tribes: How Administrative Units Shaped Ethnic Groups in Africa
item.description: How did administrative geographies (trans-)form ethnic identities in Africa?

item.title: Rulers on the Road: Itinerant Rule in the Holy Roman Empire, AD 719–1519
item.description: We study the geography of the itineraries of the emperors of the Holy Roman Empire.

item.title: State Reach and Development in Africa since the 1960s: New Data and Analysis
item.description: I show that increases in state reach measured through travel times to administrative capitals foster local development.

item.title: Linking Ethnic Data from Africa (LEDA)
item.description: We interlink 11 ethnic datasets from Africa via the language tree.

item.title: Cracking or Packing Ethnic Groups? The Colonial Design of Administrative Units in Sub-Saharan Africa
item.description: I study the roots of colonial administrative unit designs in ethnic geography.

item.title: 'Right-Peopling' the State: Nationalism, Historical Legacies and Ethnic Cleansing in Europe, 1885-2020
item.description: We analyze the violent process of ethnic homogenization of state populations in Europe since 1850.

item.title: Traditional Institutions in Africa, Past and Present
item.description: We investigate in how far today’s traditional institutions in Africa mirror their precolonial predecessors.

item.title: Nationalism and the Puzzle of Reversing State Size
item.description: We assess the roots of the decline of states’ size in ethno-nationalism.

item.title: The Future is History: Restorative Nationalism and Conflict in Post-Napoleonic Europe
item.description: We assess how historical “golden ages” affect nationalist territorial claims and conflict.

item.title: Local Ethno-Political Polarization and Election Violence in Majoritarian vs. Proportional Systems
item.description: Provides evidence that local ethno-political polarization increases violence before majoritarian but not PR elections in Africa.

item.title: Who Benefits? How Local Ethnic Demography Shapes Political Favoritism in Africa
item.description: We investigate how local ethnic demography affects strategies of favoritism in Africa.

item.title: Roads to Rule, Roads to Rebel: Relational State Capacity and Conflict in Africa
item.description: We find that roads decrease conflict risk in connecting ethnic groups to capitals, but increase it in connecting groups internally.

item.title: Continuity or Change? (In)direct Rule in British and French Colonial Africa
item.description: New historical data show that the British ruled more indirectly than the French, in particular in precolonially centralized regions.

item.title: Naming the Nation: State Building and National Identity Formation in 19th Century Germany
item.description: We study the effect of German unification on cultural homogenization using genealogical data on first names.

item.title: Indirect Rule, Cash Crop Production, and Development in Africa
item.description: Indirect colonial rule through precolonial institutions improved the developmental impact of cash crop agriculture.

item.title: Chiefs, Pre-Colonial Centralization and Development in Sub-Saharan Africa
item.description: We analyze the interplay of strong traditional institutions, public service provision, and electoral outcomes in 35 African countries.

item.title: Roads to Extraction: Natural Resources and the Physical Foundations of State Capacity in Africa
item.description: I analyze the effecs of local agricultural and mineral resources on local colonial state building.

item.title: State building, development and conflict in 20th century Africa
item.description: Spatial analyses of local state building and its effects on development and conflict.

item.title: New spatial data on ethnicity: Introducing SIDE
item.description: New data on the ethnic and religious composition of local populations in 47 low- and middle-income countries.
